reviewText: Well, that is to say, I really didn't like this movie. It may have been put together by a couple of art students who had barely passing grades. Don't waste your time on this one.

Marvin Schwartz is marvelous as the nutcase serial killer,
in a film that is both hair-raising and hilarious.
This is a very low-budget film that proves you don't need to
spend much to delight an audience.

Very interesting "documentary" about a serial-murdering stand-up comedian. We are taken along as he goes through his routines, both on the stage and while creeping up on his latest victims. Extremely black humour sure to please funny-boned sadists or those w/ a warped sense of hilarity (like me). This low-low-budget, B+W gem is also available on DECREPIT CRYPT OF NIGHTMARES...
